accessGroups.description: Access groups that have access to this plugin. If empty all have access.

apiVersion.description: Go-between API version supported. Should be set to "3" for new plugins.

arch.description: The architecture a specific package can support. This is derived from the package file name and does not need to be set in the manifest.

canAcceptQueryBasedSchemas.description: Set to true if this plugin can accept queries authored by a user.

canConfigure.description: Set to true if this plugin implements the Configure method for setting logging levels and storage locations.

canConfigureConnection.description: Set to true if this plugin can configure connections interactively. This is an alternative to setting the configSchema property. Only checked if apiVersion >= 2.

canConfigureQuery.description: Set to true if this plugin supports interactively authoring queries. This is an alternative to setting the querySchema property. Only checked if apiVersion >= 2.

canConfigureRealTime.description: Set to true if this plugin can support real time publish and configure them interactively. Only checked if apiVersion >= 2

canConfigureWrite.description: Set to true if this plugin supports interactively authoring writeback schemas.

canDiscoverShapes.description: Set to true if this plugin can discover shapes/schemas automatically. Only checked if apiVersion >= 2.

canProduceMultipleSchemas.description: Set to true if this plugin can produce multiple schemas, rather than only one.

canPublish.description: Set to true if this plugin can publish datapoints. Only checked if apiVersion >= 2.

canUseOAuth.description: Set to true if this plugin uses OAuth for authentication.

canWrite.description: Set to true if this plugin supports writing back to the data source in real time.

canWriteBatch.description: Set to true if this plugin supports writing back to the data source as a batched action (rather than in real time).

canWriteReplication.description: Set to true if this plugin can write golden record replication data to a connection.

description.description: The description to display to the user.

displayName.description: The display name of this plugin.

executable.description: The path (relative to the manifest) to execute when starting the plugin.

icon.description: The data-uri for the icon, alternative to setting the icon property.

iconFile.description: The path (relative to the manifest) to the icon to display for this plugin.

id.description: The dns-compatible name of the plugin, should be the same as the repo.

os.description: The OS a specific package can support. This is derived from the package file name and does not need to be set in the manifest.

version.description: The version of the plugin. This is derived from the package file name and does not need to be set in the manifest.

versionDescription.description: Description specific to this version. Obsolete.
